intro: Sersalisia boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin Islands sersalisia, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal vegetation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
